bug.author: abdurahman-shiine
bug.summary: Latest version doesn't work with SessionState()
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have just updated to the latest version of Streamlit, and when I tried to run one of the scripts that uses the SessionState() I got this error: AttributeError: 'Server' object has no attribute '_session_infos' <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
I tried with a simple script: import streamlit as st import SessionState session = SessionState.get(hello=st.empty(), run_id=0) session.hello.text_input('Enter a name', key=session.run_id) session.run_id += 1 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I expected to be able to write something in the widget and then reset it <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The following exception is thrown: AttributeError: 'Server' object has no attribute '_session_infos' <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.57.3 Python version: 3.7 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex?: No OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome version 80.0.3987.163 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comments.comment:
Have you tried using the last version of the st_state_patch gist? I was facing the same problem and got it working after updating it. <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/tvst/0899a5cdc9f0467f7622750896e6bd7f>https://gist.github.com/tvst/0899a5cdc9f0467f7622750896e6bd7f</denchmark-link>
I am using streamlit-nightly 0.57.4.dev20200417

Have you tried using the last version of the st_state_patch gist? I was facing the same problem and got it working after updating it. https://gist.github.com/tvst/0899a5cdc9f0467f7622750896e6bd7f I am using streamlit-nightly 0.57.4.dev20200417
I didn't actually know that there was a new version of this.. I'll try it out.. thanks
